be the fastest charge, but not the slowest either so no complaints there.I will say that when plugging them in, the plastic piece that goes into the bottom port of your controller in order to supply power to it is a little bit of a tight fit, however I believe that with time and more plugging and unplugging, I will be able to break it in a little bit and soften the tightness of the fit making it easier to slide on and off of the connector.Build quality is as you would expect from a product like this, it's light weight and cheap plastic, but that's OK in my opinion based on the price you are paying as well as the fact that it really should only be sitting in one spot not being moved around once you get it plugged in.The front two LED lit images of a controller are green when not charging, and turn red when they are letting me know it's charging properly, coupled with the fact that my controllers light bar will pulsate orange to let me know it's charging as well.I have not tried plugging this unit into any other kind of USB port such as a wall adapter and honestly, I wouldn't want to try and risk such a thing in the event that it might fry something because of the fact that this is such a budget product, so far just having it plugged into one of the front USB ports on my PS4 is causing no issues, and I would suggest doing the same, and if you need more USB ports on your console you should just get a USB hub to plug into the second remaining port on the console.All in all it works as it should and I have had no issues with it after 1 month.If anything happens within the next month or two, I will update my review.Thanks for reading.
